page.title: 11Southleigh Estate
page.content: The farmland administered by the Southleigh estate trust in this area is permenent grassland let on grazing agreements to others. The woodland area has gravel hoggin underneath and the corner adjacent to Horndean Rd and N.of Emsworth Common Rd is at present being quarried by Butser Lime Works. There is a planning obligation that when the quarrying is complete,the land is replanted and restored to forestry. The woodland is mainly oak with some chestnut. The southleigh Trust is gradually easing out of business in this area and consolidating all interests in the Clanfield area in the estate of the major land owners.They would like to sell their woodland to the local Authority for a recreation area as forestry is no longer economical.
